creditline: Gift of funds from Ellen and Fred Wells
description: Three levels, wide at bottom, thin at top; brass handles, hinges and diamond shapes (at edges); dark reddish stain; interior lined with paper
text: Korean craftsmen constructed special boxes for storing men's special dress clothing. This box would have held a ceremonial robe as well as a traditional hat (kat) made of lacquered horsehair.
title: Hat and Clothing Box (Kwan-bok ham)
